intro: Osbeckia tirunelvelica, commonly known as the Tirunelveli osbeckia, is a flowering plant native to the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its erect growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grassy areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
